intro: Tacazzea pedicellata, commonly known as the yellow star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant belonging to the Asparagaceae family. It is native to southern Africa and is characterized by its bright yellow, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Tacazzea pedicellata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
